nodes.bodyText:
Same about the name. And is 50 enough? From my understanding, we do thread dump every 10ms, then we could have 100 in one second. I think as we could collect 5 parallel, you will highly trigger queue abandon mode easily.
I suggest at least 5 * 500. @kezhenxu94 What do you think?

nodes.bodyText: Using PROFILING_THREAD_SELECTOR as index, I assume there is out of bound risk.

Are you creating so many threads for profiling tasks? I prefer to do this by using only one thread only. And don't create and dispose the thread every time. This is dangerous for JVM from my understanding. @kezhenxu94 @arugal what do you think?
Change profile using the single one thread to process. Please check.
Why use full class name?
Same here.
You have known the max size, using ArrayList please.

Don't use Config.Profile.MAX_DURATION in the initial codes. Move this initialization into the constructor. Because there may be a chance, someone accidentally loads this class before Config initialization.

Don't use Config.Profile.MAX_DURATION in the initial codes. Move this initialization into the constructor. Because there may be a chance, someone accidentally loads this class before Config initialization.
PROFILE-MONITOR-THREAD -> PROFILING-THREAD . We don't use the word monitor, because SkyWalking is monitoring many places :)
checkSegmentProfilingCanContinue -> isSegmentProfilingContinuable. Let's reduce the usage of check.
Why all these are full names?
#profiling is inside #run, why check this again?

TracingContext#finish has a listener mechanism, you don't need to check every time, you should set up a listener, then you could remove when you get the notification.
But you should notice, there is a segment finish event right now, but tracing context has an async mode today, so you need to add a notification, named as notifyAfterMainThreadFinish.
Don't check this every time, once you don't get the notification event(notifyAfterMainThreadFinish), it is safe to continue.
Renaming to ThreadProfiler. Don't use context always. You need to avoid two similar names in one place, it is very confusing when reading the codes.

nodes.bodyText: Rename to nextSeq

You should be able to use segment#equal, right? Also, you should begin to move the logic method into the entity.
This should be profilingSegmentSlot[slot].matchWith(segment.
What is segmentIsRunning=false?
No matter how many times you check the thread#isAlive, you still could face the thread is not inactive or dead at here. Try/catch this, and remove all unnecessary check.
This doesn't match the profilingStartTime. Is that a bug?
This should compare to segment startTime. slot#startTIme is not necessary.
startDump -> enum profilingStatus, which has values(READY/PROFILING/STOPPED)

+package org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.profile;
+
+import org.apache.skywalking.apm.agent.core.context.trace.TraceSegment;
+
+/**
+ * @author MrPro
+ */
+public class ProfilingSegmentContext {
+
+    // current segment id
+    private final TraceSegment segment;
+    // need to profiling thread
+    private final Thread profilingThread;
+    // profiling execution context
+    private final ProfileTaskExecutionContext executionContext;
+
+    // current segment running status, each dump will judge it. Will set false when trace notification
+    private volatile boolean segmentIsRunning = true;
+    // profiling start time
+    private long profilingStartTime;
+
+    // after min duration threshold check, it will start dump
+    private boolean startDump = false;

nodes.bodyText: checkAndAddSegmentContext -> attempProfiling
You should use TracingContext rather than segment as the parameter. segment is a collection of spans, only tracingContext has status.
Why need this check?
Why need this method? I think we just need to add a parameter in the TracingContext constructor.
If no available slot, you don't need the following steps.
This is not must be endpoint name. This is only first span OP name.
You don't need to findService every time. Please add a field to hold the ref.
Notify current tracing context main thread has already execute finished. -> Notify after tracing finished in the main thread.
This notification should not be in (!isRunningInAsyncMode || asyncSpanCounter.get() == 0)). The condition means async finished.  You just need activeSpanStack.isEmpty() && running.
Why does the segment still need this? This should be moved into TracingContext.
threadProfilerSlot  -> threadProfilerSlots
Why don't move this into L118, then you don't need find flag and related codes.
As this method could be called in another thread, you need to set the whole array again, and add volatile, read solution 2, https://www.javamex.com/tutorials/volatile_arrays.shtml
segment should not exist. Dump the executing thread stack.

nodes.bodyText: Is this for shutdown process only?
Yes, I think it will only end when other threads notify him, unless he actively raises an exception.
I think you change this by mistake. Please revert.
tracingFinishInMainThread -> isFinishedInMainThread

I think we don't need ContextManager#profilingRecheck. There is a ref of tracingContext in the span, check AbstractTracingSpan. You should use it, it is better to keep profilingRecheck in private, right?
I think you missed the profilingSegmentSlots resign to make volatile works.
Don't put the link here. The article is just reference, we don't have the license to broadcast it.
Same as before, don't use Config in the field initialization. Use it in the constructor.
Merge tryToAttemptProfiling -> attemptProfiling. Similar name, always use in the same time.
Why does this check happen at the start stage? I think when totalStartedProfilingCount reaches max count, this profile should be at the profiling stage. Do I miss anything?

You are right, the check happens on the profiling stage. Maybe name as you feel confused, I change the name to isProfileable. It will invoke on ThreadProfiler#startProfilingIfNeed. When the tracing context starts time bigger than profile task minDurationThresold, It will have a check.
Once the profile starts, it should not stop.
Otherwise, if I set a profiling task targeting a Tomcat endpoint name, it will never execute as SpringMVC must override it
This isn't segmentContext, please rename.
This line is really confusing, what does it do?
You need to follow prefer review comments :) This is for activating volatile :P
You are changing the element of an array, the volatile would work unless we do this.

You need to follow prefer review comments :) This is for activating volatile :P
You are changing the element of an array, the volatile would work unless we do this.

Well sorry I indeed lose the context here, but why not simply use java.util.concurrent.atomic.AtomicReferenceArray, it does the same thing, even if we cannot use this class, for some reasons, it should be documented, later contributors may be hard to follow the review comments, especially when this gets merged, and people like you and me may forget the reason in some day, and the IDE is "too enthusiastic“ to hint that one should remove it:

I remember that did this in different way. Can't remember the detail.Personally, I just use the easy way.
@mrproliu you could add doc, but don't use the link to that blog.
Make sense for switching to AtomicReferenceArray in this case.
Change slot to the AtomicReferenceArray, please recheck. @wu-sheng @kezhenxu94
And this one

I prefer to let this method return an Exception, maybe java.lang.IllegalStateException, simply return a string is no so semantic, and you may want to print the stack trace there, since it's a kind of "exception", in some degree
In this case, I prefer to return a Result class, rather than exception. Profiling is happening in a high payload scenario, but Exception is a heavy OP. We should avoid it.

In this case, I prefer to return a Result class, rather than exception. Profiling is happening in a high payload scenario, but Exception is a heavy OP. We should avoid it.

Sounds good to me
@kezhenxu94 @wu-sheng resolved, please check

You have so many JavaDocs like this, please add corresponding descriptions, or remove the @param and @return, although it can compile, it produces uncountable warnings in CI (javadoc:javadoc), and many many warnings in the IDE, making it hard to discover warnings that really matters:
You don't return anything at all
Same here
if Config.Profile.ACTIVE ==  false TracingThreadSnapshot should be ignored, right?
If not active profile, there will not going to happen.  I think it is useless to add judgment here, and it will also increase the cost of judgment.
sorry, I was wrong.
